404.caption: The secret you're looking for may be invalid or expired.

500.caption: We're not exactly sure what happened, but our servers say something is wrong.

learnMore.body1: Sendsecure.ly uses TLS 1.2 to securely transmit your secret to Basis Theory's PCI Level 1 and SOC 2 compliant environment. In exchange, sendsecure.ly receives an undecipherable and non-sensitive token that it uses to generate a time-boxed single-use link.
learnMore.body2: The link can be copied and shared with anyone but redeemed only once. In addition, the author sets an expiration timeframe, making the secret valid for a limited amount of timeâ€”up to 24h. Once opened or expired, sendsecure.ly and Basis Theory will automatically purge your secret from their systems.
learnMore.body3: Explore how <1>Basis Theory</1> helps developers build secure applications in minutes.
